member.name: T:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess
member.summary: Provides an external process for running add-ins out-of-process from the host application.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.#ctor(System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the bits-per-word of the process in which the add-in runs.
member.param: A value that specifies the bits-per-word of the process that runs the add-in.
member.exception: The registry entry for the path to the executable (AddInProcess.exe or AddInProcess32.exe) is missing.-or-The executable is missing.

member.name: P:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.IsCurrentProcess
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current object represents the host application process.
member.returns: true if the object corresponds to the current process; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.KeepAlive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to keep the external process alive.
member.returns: true if the external process should be kept alive; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.Platform
member.summary: Gets the bits-per-word of the process in which the out-of-process add-in is run.
member.returns: The bits-per-word of the process that runs the add-in.

member.name: P:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.ProcessId
member.summary: Gets the process ID of the external process.
member.returns: The process ID, or -1 if the external process has not started.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.Shutdown
member.summary: Forcibly shuts down the external process.
member.returns: true if the external process was running and is successfully shut down; false if there is no active process associated with the .
member.exception: The add-in is running in-process with the host application. Starting and stopping the process is allowed only for external processes, not for the host process.

member.name: E:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.ShuttingDown
member.summary: Occurs when the process represented by the object is about to be shut down.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.Start
member.summary: Starts the external process.
member.returns: true if the process is successfully started; false if the process is already running.
member.exception: The add-in is running in-process with the host application. Starting and stopping the process is allowed only for external processes, not for the host process.

member.name: P:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInProcess.StartupTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to allow for the process to start.
member.returns: The number of seconds to allow for process startup.
member.exception: The process is already running.
The assigned value is less than 0 (zero).

member.name: T:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInSecurityLevel
member.summary: Specifies the trust level that is granted to the application domain that an add-in is loaded into.

member.name: F:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInSecurityLevel.Internet
member.summary: Use the Internet security level for add-ins that have a low trust level.

member.name: F:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInSecurityLevel.Intranet
member.summary: Use the Intranet security level for add-ins that are located on a company's intranet. These add-ins can have a greater trust level because the servers and information are within a company's firewall.

member.name: F:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInSecurityLevel.FullTrust
member.summary: Use the full trust security level for add-ins that are allowed to read and write to the local file system, create network connections, and read from the registry. This security level grants full access to the add-in's code access security (CAS) by applying the field.

member.name: F:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInSecurityLevel.Host
member.summary: Use the host security level to give the add-in the same permissions currently granted to the hosting code.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.FindAddIns(System.Type,System.AddIn.Hosting.PipelineStoreLocation)
member.summary: Finds all add-ins for a specified host view of the add-in at a location specified by the enumeration value.
member.returns: A collection of tokens that represent the add-ins that were found.
member.param: The type that defines the host's view of the add-in.
The host application's base directory.
member.exception: There is an access violation to the pipeline directory structure.
is an invalid value.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.FindAddIns(System.Type,System.AddIn.Hosting.PipelineStoreLocation,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds all add-ins for a specified host view of the add-in at the location specified by a value and an optional add-ins folder.
member.returns: A collection of tokens that represent the add-ins that were found.
member.param: The type that defines the host's view of the add-in.
One of the enumeration values.Currently the only value in this enumeration is the directory specified by the property that was used to set up the host's application domain.

(Optional). The path of the directory that contains one or more subdirectories of add-ins. Because this parameter takes an array of strings, you can specify more than one path.This parameter is not required if your add-ins are located in the pipeline directory structure under the AddIns folder.
member.exception: There is an access violation to the pipeline directory structure.
is an invalid value.

member.name: M:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.FindAddIns(System.Type,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds all add-ins for a specified host view of the add-in from a specified root directory.
member.returns: A collection of tokens that represent the add-ins that were found.
member.param: The type that defines the host's view of the add-in.
The path of the root of the pipeline directory structure.

(Optional). The path of the directory that contains one or more subdirectories of add-ins. Because this parameter takes an array of strings, you can specify more than one path.This parameter is not required if your add-ins are located in the pipeline directory structure under the AddIns folder.
member.exception: There is an access violation to the pipeline directory structure.
